q: from a briefing President Lyndon Johnson gave in 1966 on the Vietnam War and White House papers from July 1975-- when he was chief of staff under President Lyndon Johnson Gerald Ford -- with passages initialed by Donald Rumsfeld 's then-assistant, Dick Cheney . It's not a journal, it's not a diary, he says of the Gerald Ford White House notes." It is a set of working documents that I've never edited. In fact, most I've never reread." warns Social Security may be on Franklin Roosevelt chopping block, a US Barack Obama recently told Raw Story, expressing deep uneasiness about Barack Obama 's noncommittal attitude toward staving off cuts to the cherished program.
